thread.title: Donald Trump's childhood home in Queens sells — see inside
thread.title_full: Donald Trump's childhood home in Queens sells — see inside - TODAY.com

author: Melissa Allison
title: Donald Trump's childhood home in Queens sells — see inside
text:
The real estate investor who bought Donald Trump’s childhood home in Queens last month has resold it in an auction.
Paramount Realty USA The Tudor home in the Jamaica Estates neighborhood was built in 1940 by Trump’s father, a local real estate developer and landlord. It’s where the president spent his early childhood.
Paramount Realty USA More Home videos 0:42 See the tiny library that sits in the woods of upstate New York 3:10 Go behind the scenes as Obamas move out of White House and Trumps move in 0:56 What it takes to move one president out and another in at the White House 0:39 Meet the family that lives in the ‘Bachelor’ home The 5-bedroom, 4.5-bath home measures 2,500 square feet and has a finished basement with a full bathroom. There’s also a bonus room for guests and a summer kitchen.
Paramount Realty USA Paramount Realty USA RELATED: Donald Trump sells 5-bedroom New York apartment for $21 million
The home features a living room with a fireplace, a formal dining room and an enclosed back porch, along with the charm of arched doorways and hardwood floors.
Paramount Realty USA Paramount Realty USA It was first listed last summer for $1.65 million, but it took a couple price cuts before Paramount Realty USA planned an auction for the evening of one of Trump and Hillary Clinton’s debates.
Paramount Realty USA RELATED: Trump's former Connecticut home on the market
That auction was postponed. Then, real estate investor Michael Davis bought the home for $1.39 million.
Paramount Realty USA Paramount Realty USA Davis, in turn, auctioned the home last week. The winning bidder and bid amount will not be disclosed, according to Misha Haghani, a principal at Paramount Realty USA.
Paramount Realty USA Paramount Realty USA Photos courtesy of Paramount Realty USA.
